visualization_prompt: Generate a candlestick chart showing USD/EUR exchange rate volatility with a 50-day simple moving average using synthetic OHLC data generation and trend analysis
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time-series dimensions: daily OHLC exchange rates (quantitative continuous) and 50-day SMA (derived quantitative continuous). Synthetic data was generated with μ=0.95 EUR/USD base rate, σ=0.03 volatility, and +0.008/month upward trend, maintaining financial plausibility through constrained price spreads and temporal consistency. The candlestick chart maximizes data-ink ratio by encoding four price dimensions in single visual elements, while the orange SMA line follows Cairo's prominence principle for trend identification. Color encoding (blue down candles/green up candles) leverages pre-attentive processing for immediate bull/bear market recognition. Statistical anchors: initial rate 0.915 (±0.015 daily variation), 10.3% annualized growth rate with r²=0.97 trendline fit.
